page.title: 15Pubs,Inns and Clubs in Rye
page.content: Rye has a great number of pubs for such a small area. Most of them date back in history and some have secret passageways which were used by smugglers. One pub called the Hope and Anchor has a tunnel going down to the Strand, which smugglers used to smuggle brandy through. The Mermaid Inn has an upstairs floor where the famous Hawkhurst Gang used to meet. There are also a very large range of clubs_for Brownies, Cubs and Camera Enthusiasts and the Friends of Rye Art Gallery. There are the well known Rye Singers who give marvellous concerts. There are clubs for Drama and Nature Conservation. With sports clubs and two Women's Institutes plus many others, everyone should find something to suit them.
